content: Maybe somebody at HL7.de will see this message. When going to http://download.hl7.de/documents/ucum/ucumdata.html and downloading the TSV version of "Commonly Used UCUM Codes", that downloaded file contains errors in the units. For example, the UCUM code meq/L has a display string of meg/L associated with it. Also, sometimes mL gets changed to mm^3 or cc â€“ which is technically correct but may be unexpected.
@Simone Heckmann can you refer this please?
That page says it got the data from CDC's PHIN-VADS, but I'm unable to get the original file. Guess I'll have to try harder.
Uh sorry! I didn't realize this was hl7.de when I forst looked. I will forward this!
@Heike Dewenter @dr Kai U. Heitmann @Christof Gessner @Sylvia Thun
There is a newer one from LOINC, see https://loinc.org/usage/units/
best source as of today is https://loinc.org/usage/units/
ha, duplicating. we will update the hl7.de soon.
I think the FHIR list of common UCUM units is better than the LOINC list. ;-)

Both the list from UCUM and FHIR include "display names", but not nice displayable unit labels (like mmHg for mm[Hg]).
Also fun that a list named "Common UCUM Units" from LOINC contains stuff like "short ton U.S. ton". I wonder what lab value uses that unit. :D
